alert.note: Alert for Los Angeles (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 14 at 12:09PM PST until January 15 at 2:15PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest California, including the following county, Los Angeles. * WHEN...Until 315 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Heavy rainfall could trigger minor debris flows in and near recent wildfire burn scars. Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1207 PM PST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated moderate rain moving across the area. Hourly rainfall rates between 0.25 and 0.40 inches have been observed. These rainfall rates will cause urban and small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Long Beach, Malibu, Acton, Burbank, Universal City, North Hollywood, Hollywood, Pasadena, Downtown Los Angeles, Beverly Hills, Alhambra, Van Nuys, Mount Wilson, Culver City, Encino, Inglewood, Northridge and Santa Monica. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
